Document Sources.Sourced Statement: The Standard viewed one Friday-morning boarding pass for a Chicago-bound flight that warned of long security lines and recommended arriving three hours early.
Document Sources.Source Justification: The Standard viewed one Friday-morning boarding pass for a Chicago-bound flight that warned of long security lines and recommended arriving three hours early.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: More than 930,000 travelers will funnel through SFO from Thursday through Tuesday, according to SFO spokesperson Doug Yakel.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: according to SFO spokesperson Doug Yakel

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: This year’s prediction is 97% of what the airport handled five years ago, Yakel said by email.
To make it on time, holiday travelers should arrive at the airport two hours before domestic flights and three hours before international ones, Yakel said.
Yakel said SFO has not been advised of staffing woes for Thursday, which was expected to be the busiest day of travel at the airport.
Parking at airport garages will be in short supply this weekend, so travelers who want to leave cars at SFO should reserve spaces online as soon as possible, Yakel said.

“I have TSA Pre, so that should make it a little easier,” said Bay Area resident Katelin Tharp, who on Thursday was booted from an overbooked flight to Boston, where she’s beginning her fifth year at Northeastern University.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Bay Area resident Katelin Tharp, who on Thursday was booted from an overbooked flight to Boston, where she’s beginning her fifth year at Northeastern University

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We’re sad since we just said goodbye to our one friend, and we don’t know if we’re ever going to see her again,” Ellie Mitchell, of the United Kingdom, told The Standard.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Ellie Mitchell, of the United Kingdom

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: United Airlines advised passengers to leave even more time.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: United Airlines advised passengers to leave even more time.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: A United Airlines spokesperson said the three-hour warning was issued by mistake: somehow the company posted a years-old notice to the Chicago-bound boarding pass.

The spokesperson shared a corrected advisory that suggested passengers “arrive early to avoid delays,” and to get a head start by checking bags from home and leaving luggage in the bag drop shortcut area at the airport.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: The spokesperson shared a corrected advisory

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: There are no major projects on the freeways near SFO, so with a bit of luck, drivers headed to the airport shouldn’t face major delays, Caltrans officials said.
